alert.note: Alert for Massac; Pope (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 19 at 5:27AM CDT until July 19 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Massac County in southern Illinois... Southeastern Pope County in southern Illinois... Southwestern Crittenden County in western Kentucky... Livingston County in western Kentucky... Northwestern Marshall County in western Kentucky... Northwestern Lyon County in western Kentucky... * Until 615 AM CDT. * At 527 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Burna to 9 miles north of Ledbetter to near Brookport, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Calvert City, Eddyville, Demumbers Bay Campground, Land Between The Lakes Area, Salem, Burna, Ledbetter, Kuttawa, Grand Rivers, Smithland, Hamletsburg and Dycusburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 18 and 43. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 50 and 73. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Paducah.
